Cukai Rokok Naik 23%, Kemenkeu: Bukan Hal Luar Biasa
04 Nov 2019, 08:06 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - Pemerintah melalui Peraturan Menteri Keuangan (PMK) nomor 152 tahun 2019 telah menetapkan kenaikan cukai rokok rata-rata 23%, dan harga jual eceran (HJE) rata-rata 35% mulai tahun 2020. Kenaikan tersebut menjadi kontroversi baik di tingkat petani, tenaga kerja, dan juga industri.Isu-isu PHK karyawan, peredaran rokok ilegal marak, dan lain-lain menghantui kebijakan kenaikan cukai rokok rata-rata 23% ini. Menjawab hal tersebut, Direktur Jenderal (Dirjen) Bea dan Cukai Kemenkeu, Heru Pambudi mengatakan, kenaikan cukai rokok kali ini bukanlah hal yang luar biasa. Ia mengatakan, cukai rokok memang setiap tahun naik 10%. Mengingat dua tahun ke belakang cukai rokok tak naik, maka kenaikan 23% kali ini dinilainya wajar."Kalau kita perhatikan setiap tahun itu naiknya juga 10%, bukan hal yang luar biasa. Dan kita tidak mendengar ada gejolak yang luar biasa," kata Heru di kantor Kemenkeu, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Menurut Heru, meskipun kenaikan cukai rokok rata-rata 23%, namun pada implementasinya bervariasi. Ia mencontohkan, untuk rokok jenis Sigaret Kretek Tangan (SKT) saja kenaikannya dimulai dari 12%."Kalau kita perhatikan PMK 152 itu meskipun average-nya adalah 23% dan 35%, tapi kalau kita lihat detailnya itu variatif. Pemerintah betul-betul telah memperhatikan kemampuan antar golongan, kemampuan antar jenis rokok. Sehingga kenaikan cukai rokok jenis SKT start-nya dari 12%," jelas Heru.Kemudian, dalam menetapkan kenaikan cukai rokok jenis SKT yang paling rendah membuktikan bahwa pemerintah memperhatikan nasib pekerja dan petani di industri padat karya tersebut."Itu membuktikan bahwa pemerintah memperhatikan tenaga kerja yang di industri padat karya, makanya kenaikan tarif SKT itu terendah. Ini berbeda dengan yang mesin, yang relatuif lebih tinggi," imbuh dia.Selain itu, Heru berpendapat, di level petani tembakau kekhawatiran utama yang dirasakan adalah soal penyerapan, bukan kenaikan cukai rokok. Hal tersebut ia sampaikan usai ia bertemu dengan Asosiasi Petani Tembakau Indonesia (APTI) Jabar yang berdemo di depan kantornya."Petani concern-nya sebenarnya tidak terkait langsung dengan tarif. Tetapi mereka memang mengkaitkan dengan tarif. Begitu diskusi, ternyata kami memahami bahwa concern mereka adalah keterserapan dari hasil tembakau, pertanian mereka, dan solusinya sudah kami sampaikan," urainya. Cigarette Excise Increases 23%, Ministry of Finance: Not Extraordinary
04 Nov 2019, 08:06 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - The government through the Minister of Finance Regulation (PMK) number 152 2019 has set an average cigarette tax increase of 23%, and the retail sale price (HJE) an average of 35% starting in 2020. The increase is a good controversy at the farm level, labor, and also industry. Issues of layoffs of employees, rampant illegal cigarette circulation, and others haunt the policy of increasing cigarette excise on average by 23%. Responding to this, the Director General (Dirjen) of Customs and Excise of the Ministry of Finance, Heru Pambudi said, the increase in cigarette excise duty this time was not unusual. He said, cigarette excise tax indeed rose 10% every year. Considering the two years back the cigarette excise tax did not go up, the increase of 23% this time is considered reasonable. "If we pay attention every year the increase is also 10%, not extraordinary. And we do not hear any extraordinary turmoil," said Heru in the Ministry of Finance's office, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019). According to Heru, despite the increase in cigarette excise averages 23%, the implementation varies. He gave an example, for Hand Clove Cigarettes (SKT), the increase starts from 12%. "If we look at PMK 152, although the average is 23% and 35%, but if we look at the details it is varied. The government has really pay attention to the ability between groups, the ability between types of cigarettes. So the increase in excise tax on cigarettes starts from 12%, "Heru explained. Then, in setting the lowest tax excise tax increases proves that the government pays attention to the fate of workers and farmers in the dense industry "It proves that the government pays attention to workers in labor-intensive industries, so the increase in SKT rates is the lowest. This is different from the machines, which are relatively higher," he added. In addition, Heru argues, at the level of tobacco farmers the concern the main thing that is felt is a matter of absorption, not an increase in cigarette excise duty. He said this after he met with the Indonesian Tobacco Farmers Association (APTI) in West Java who demonstrated in front of his office. "Farmers' concerns are actually not directly related to tariffs. But they do link to tariffs. As soon as the discussion, it turns out we understand that their concerns "We have already conveyed the absorption of tobacco products, their agriculture, and the solution," he explained.
